Description: Large rough straw-tempered Nile silt pottery vase with flat base, convex sides and out-turned roll rim, exterior marked with areas of smoke discolouration. Circular potmark incised on the shoulder post-firing.
Curator's comments: Potmark illustrated in W.M.F Petrie and A.C. Mace, Diospolis Parva, London (1901), pl. xxiii.295. Like Rough ware R45b in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921).
